intro: Idiothamnus pseudorgyalis, commonly known as the golden everlasting, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its dense clusters of small, yellow flowers. The plant has a woody stem and produces small, leathery pods that contain seeds. It is often found in sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens in suitable climates.
